issue.title: [help needed] Add notes on how to run unit and functional tests in QEMU
issue.body: QEMU allows to emulate a processor (even of different architecture). We cross-compile to aarch64 and arm64, among others. Even though developers run tests on those architectures sporadically, it would be nice if there was documentation or a script in our repo on how to do that in QEMU.

events.body:
What do you mean by this?
Like how to setup such a system?
Hi, I would like to contribute and have a go at this issue. Would that be okay?

> Hi, I would like to contribute and have a go at this issue. Would that be okay?

@kakirastern Yes. Make sure you also checkout CONTRIBUTING.md.
Thanks for the prompt reply @fanquake ! Yup. will do.

> Hi, I would like to contribute and have a go at this issue. Would that be okay?

No need to ask for permission if you want to help out. :)
Ideally where should such a script or scripts be located? Should I do one in `/bitcoin/src/test` for the unit tests and a separate one in `/bitcoin/test/functional` for the functional tests?
Oh, I forgot that this already exists: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/docs/pull/49
Not a problem @MarcoFalke. Some version of it is still needed for AArch64 and ARM64 (in lieu of RISC-V) as in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16576#issuecomment-529216599?

Or I could build on that [PR](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/docs/blob/daafacf5b711b1b287a04f804046b038250a0f4f/testing/qemu_riscv.md) on setting up RISC-V emulation for testing and generalise it by adding more information to it. The documents will be in different locations so some overlapping of contents should not be that much of a big deal.
